info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 23 at 4:21AM EST until February 25 at 12:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow and sleet accumulations of an inch or so, and ice accumulations of more than one quarter of an inch possible. * WHERE...Cambria, Somerset and Bedford Counties. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel will be slowed significantly. The hazardous conditions may affect the Thursday evening commute, and are almost certain to seriously impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ice accumulation is the most significant hazard with this storm. A short period of mixed precipitation will change to a long period of freezing rain that will last much of the night. Temperatures will warm slightly above freezing on Friday morning, ending the freezing rain threat.
info.instruction: There is the potential for significant winter weather that may impact travel. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
